ITEM.szItemDesc: Standard issue sniper rifle of the USMC. Highly accurate with good penetration.
ITEM.szBRDesc: SPECIAL PRICE! The USMC standard issue M40A1 sniper rifle of the is being replaced by the M40A3, which means we are receiving more shipments of these babies than we can handle and they all must go!

ITEM.szItemDesc: A classic bolt-action rifle, now being offered in 6.8x43mm SPC. Perfect for all any hunter going after big game.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A classic bolt-action rifle, now being offered in 6.8x43mm SPC. Perfect for all any hunter going after big game.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The M60E3 is a smaller, lighter and improved version of the legendary M60 light machinegun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Always wanted to be like Rambo? Now you can! With the M60E3, you'll always look good taking out a drug cartel, mowing down local mob bosses, and stopping an entire invasion force on your own. Buy now and receive a free Rambo action figure!

ITEM.szItemDesc: French Army pistol with an unusual locking mechanism.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Discontinued when MAB went out of business. Buy while stocks last.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A MacMillian Tac-50 was used for the current distance record for a sniper kill (2430m). The included heavy bipod should be reminder that this bolt action gun should only be used prone.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A MacMillian Tac-50 was used for the current distance record for a sniper kill (2430m). The included heavy bipod should be reminder that this bolt action gun should only be used prone.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This former Israeli pistol is about as subtle as a hand-held nuke, is now made in the good ol' USA.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This single-action, power-packed, gas-operated pistol is one hundred per cent U.S. made. Originally produced in Israel, it features a rotating bolt for positive lock-up, an ambidextrous safety, a steel frame, and a nickel or chrome finish.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A variant of the Magnum Desert Eagle that packs the extra punch of a .44 calibre round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A variant of the Magnum Desert Eagle that packs the extra punch of a .44 calibre round. Often used as protection from large animals and tourists.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In 1991, the Desert Eagle earned overnight notoriety when this .50 AE variant was revealed.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In 1991, the Desert Eagle earned overnight notoriety when this .50 AE variant was revealed. Massive firepower in a massive pistol.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Lone Eagle pistol exists in a wide variety of calibers, this one is chambered for .50 Action Express.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Lone Eagle takes a scope, and has seen use as a rifle substitute in at least one South American setting.

ITEM.szItemDesc: All the family traits of the Desert Eagle but in only 400 grams. The gas-assisted blowback system used in the Micro Desert Eagle increases reliability, making sure this hold out pistol will fire when you need it.
ITEM.szBRDesc: All the family traits of the Desert Eagle but in only 400 grams. The gas-assisted blowback system used in the Micro Desert Eagle increases reliability, making sure this hold out pistol will fire when you need it.

ITEM.szItemDesc: MagPul's Personal Defense Rifle is as lethal as a carbine, but is as handy as a combat pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: MagPul's Personal Defense Rifle has more firepower than pistols like the M9, while being handier than the M4 carbine. This one is chambered in 5.56mm NATO.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed as the ideal gun for non-infantry personnel the Personal Defense Rifle is also sought after by Special Forces needing a compact weapon but wanting to use standard ammunition.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Designed as the ideal gun for non-infantry personnel the Personal Defense Rifle is also sought after by Special Forces needing a compact weapon but wanting to use standard ammunition.

ITEM.szItemDesc: MagPul's Personal Defense Rifle is as lethal as a carbine, but is as handy as a combat pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: MagPul's Personal Defense Rifle has more firepower than pistols like the M9, while being handier than the M4 carbine. This one is chambered in 6.8mm SPC.

ITEM.szItemDesc: MagPul's Personal Defense Rifle is as lethal as a carbine, but is as handy as a combat pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: MagPul's Personal Defense Rifle has more firepower than pistols like the M9, while being handier than the M4 carbine. This one is chambered in 6.5x35.

ITEM.szItemDesc: While the Post WWII era Makarov PM is not the most powerful weapon around, it's still fairly reliable.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Makarov PM (Pistolet Makarova) evolved from the post-WW2 Soviet Army requirements for a new pistol: more compact, more safe and with greater stopping power than the then-standard Tokarev TT-33 pistol.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Developed in the 1960s for Spetsnaz and KGB use, the Makarov PB is basically a PM with an integral suppressor and barrel porting to make subsonic the normally supersonic 9x18mm round. Note it doesn’t quite fit standard holsters.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Developed in the 1960s for Spetsnaz and KGB use, the Makarov PB is basically a PM with an integral suppressor and barrel porting to make subsonic the normally supersonic 9x18mm round. Note it doesn’t quite fit standard holsters.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A modified version of the Makarov PM, developed during the 1990's.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A modified version of the Makarov PM, developed during the 1990's. This model attempts to address the original's deficiencies: small clip size and low stopping power.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A modified version of the Makarov PM, developed during the 1990's.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A modified version of the Makarov PM, developed during the 1990's. This model attempts to address the original's deficiencies: small clip size and low stopping power.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Mostly based on S&W revolvers, but with a few features of its own, the MR-73 is the backbone of Manurhin's revolver production.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A French police revolver in use with GIGN, the French counter-terrorist unit, which tells a lot about the quality of this gun.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Mostly based on S&W revolvers, but with a few features of its own, the MR-73 is the backbone of Manurhin's revolver production.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A French police revolver in use with GIGN, the French counter-terrorist unit, which tells a lot about the quality of this gun.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A MAT Modele 1949, common in former French colonies. The magazine well doubles as a grip, and can fold away for compact storage.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Index 4715

This revolver is notable for its recoil operated semi-auto action. Firing from the lower chamber, gives it competition pistol-like recoil management, making this a very comfortable weapon to fire despite being chambered for the all powerful .454 Casull.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This revolver is notable for its recoil operated semi-auto action. Firing from the lower chamber, gives it competition pistol-like recoil management, making this a very comfortable weapon to fire despite being chambered for the all powerful .454 Casull.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A stock and longer barrel turns the Mateba Model 6 Unica into a very powerful carbine. Modern features like the optics RIS make the Mateba Grifone a viable alternative to many more conventional tactical rifles.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A stock and longer barrel turns the Mateba Model 6 Unica into a very powerful carbine. Modern features like the optics RIS make the Mateba Grifone a viable alternative to many more conventional tactical rifles.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The standard rifle of the German army during World War II. Rifles made after 1942 may have cheaper furniture and fittings, but the Germans never went cheap on barrel, bolt, and action.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This well constructed carbine version of the Gewehr 98 was Germany's standard rifle during World War II. Price is for guns of later production runs, earlier rifles on order. Ammo in stripper clips can be found in the Ammo-section.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Classic Mauser 98 quality in a modern hunting rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Classic Mauser 98 quality in a modern hunting rifle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Ahead of its time, or historical small arms deadend - that is up to you. When this weapon does fire, it is relatively silent, produces little recoil, and 50% more energy than .45ACP at optimal range.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Ahead of its time, or historical small arms deadend - that is up to you. When this weapon does fire, it is relatively silent, produces little recoil, and 50% more energy than .45ACP at optimal range.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Manufacturing variances cause unguided rocket propelled rounds to be somewhat more unpredictable than purely ballistic bullets after leaving the barrel. The Gyrojet Rifle has a longer barrel and shoulder stock to achieve greater accuracy over the (in)famous pistol it is based on.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Manufacturing variances cause unguided rocket propelled rounds to be somewhat more unpredictable than purely ballistic bullets after leaving the barrel. The Gyrojet Rifle has a longer barrel and shoulder stock to achieve greater accuracy over the (in)famous pistol it is based on.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Electronics give Metal Storm firearms an obscenely high rate of fire and fingerprint security.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Metal Storm's obscene rate of fire is always an attention grabber. Featherweight reliable mass firepower sells it. It makes sense that the Surf Zone is secured by an electronic fingerprint lock.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Thanks to Metal Storm technology the MAUL shotgun attachment is the lightest underslug secondary weapon available short of a bayonet.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Thanks to Metal Storm technology the MAUL shotgun attachment is the lightest underslug secondary weapon available short of a bayonet.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Inspired by the American-180, the MGV-176 now produced in Slovenia uses modern methods and materials to produce a weapon with similar qualities but for lower cost.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Mosin Nagant was the standard infantry weapon for the defenders of the motherland from 1891 until the late 1940s.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Used by snipers from Stalingrad to Saigon, budding Zaitsevs everywhere will love the Mosin-Nagant.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The OTs-48 is one of the many surplus but still very accurate Mosin-Nagant actions rebuilt on a modern stock. This reborn bolt-action rifle is an excellent choice for the paramilitary force on a tight budget.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The OTs-48 is one of the many surplus but still very accurate Mosin-Nagant actions rebuilt on a modern stock. This reborn bolt-action rifle is an excellent choice for the paramilitary force on a tight budget.

ITEM.szItemDesc: With plenty of Mosin-Nagant actions available in Russian military storage, a small number were rebuilt on modern bull-pup stocks.
ITEM.szBRDesc: With plenty of Mosin-Nagant actions available in Russian military storage, a small number were rebuilt on modern bull-pup stocks.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A quality lever action rifle in .22LR with a similar action to the famous Winchester Model 94 but able to accept longer cartridges. A walnut stock adds to the classic look of this American made firearm.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A quality lever action rifle in .22LR with a similar action to the famous Winchester Model 94 but able to accept longer cartridges. A walnut stock adds to the classic look of this American made firearm.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Mossberg has taken the classic action of the Model 464 given it a threaded barrel, tri-rail handguard, and adjustable tactical stock. Available in standard SPX and specialist anti-Zombie ZMB versions.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Mossberg has taken the classic action of the Model 464 given it a threaded barrel, tri-rail handguard, and adjustable tactical stock. Available in standard SPX and specialist anti-Zombie ZMB versions.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Rare bullpup version of the prolific Mossberg 500.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Offered with different barrel lengths, shell capacities, and stock options, the Mossberg 500 has been a trusted weapon for law enforcement and military users since the 1960s. This is the stock-less "Cruiser" variant for compact storage in police cruisers.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Offered with different barrel lengths, shell capacities, and stock options, the Mossberg 500 has been a trusted weapon for law enforcement and military users since the 1960s. This is the stock-less "Cruiser" variant for compact storage in police cruisers.

ITEM.szBRDesc: The PYa (Pistolet Yarygina - codenamed Grach) was developed for the Russian Army in the early 1990s. A conservative, but well balanced and sturdy pistol, with adequate accuracy and decent firepower.

ITEM.szItemDesc: One of the newest handgun models in use in the Russian military.
ITEM.szBRDesc: One of the newest handgun models in use in the Russian military, the Varjag features a frame made from super strong thermosetting plastic material.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The MP-446 Viking is a sporting derivative of the MP-443 Grach pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The MP-446 Viking is a sporting derivative of the MP-443 Grach pistol. It's similar in design, but its frame is made from advanced composites to reduce wear and tear.

ITEM.szItemDesc: If you find yourself with plenty of 9x19mm ammunition, in need of sustained firepower, and where a SMG is oversized for the situation - try this AR-15 pistol. This pistol accepts many of the same accessories used on the newer M4 and M16 rifles.
ITEM.szBRDesc: If you find yourself with plenty of 9x19mm ammunition, in need of sustained firepower, and where a SMG is oversized for the situation - try this AR-15 pistol. This pistol accepts many of the same accessories used on the newer M4 and M16 rifles.

ITEM.szItemDesc: While the idea of an AR-pistol may be fun on the range - you know that having a stock means that you'll have a decent chance of hitting the target. Add the right trigger group and you have a supreme CQB weapon in 9x19mm.
ITEM.szBRDesc: While the idea of an AR-pistol may be fun on the range - you know that having a stock means that you'll have a decent chance of hitting the target. Add the right trigger group and you have a supreme CQB weapon in 9x19mm.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The extra weight of this "pistol" will certainly help with controlling the powerful 10mm Auto round. Its 6.5 inch barrel gives this weapon excellent accuracy for its class.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The extra weight of this "pistol" will certainly help with controlling the powerful 10mm Auto round. Its 6.5 inch barrel gives this weapon excellent accuracy for its class.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The "Micro" prefix does little to diminish the power of the 10mm Auto round this AR based compact carbine fires.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The "Micro" prefix does little to diminish the power of the 10mm Auto round this AR based compact carbine fires.

ITEM.szItemDesc: AR-15 pistols are right there in between a pistol and a long arm. The .22 Long Rifle is popular for both pistols and long arms. The PAR-22 is therefore the perfect combination of the two.
ITEM.szBRDesc: AR-15 pistols are right there in between a pistol and a long arm. The .22 Long Rifle is popular for both pistols and long arms. The PAR-22 is therefore the perfect combination of the two.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Micro AR in .22 LR (MAR-22) for those days when you need to make a lot of holes, against unarmoured targets, but do not want to spend too much money.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A Micro AR in .22 LR (MAR-22) for those days when you need to make a lot of holes, against unarmoured targets, but do not want to spend too much money.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Out of a short barrel, the .300 Blackout round has the same muzzle energy as the 5.56mm from a 14.5inch barrel. The recoil characteristics are also broadly similar to the 5.56mm - light enough to allow comfortable shooting from a pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Out of a short barrel, the .300 Blackout round has the same muzzle energy as the 5.56mm from a 14.5inch barrel. The recoil characteristics are also broadly similar to the 5.56mm - light enough to allow comfortable shooting from a pistol.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Out of a short barrel, the .300 Blackout round has the same muzzle energy as the 5.56mm from a 14.5inch barrel. This gun gives you military standard lethality from a lighter and much more manoeuvrable weapon.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Out of a short barrel, the .300 Blackout round has the same muzzle energy as the 5.56mm from a 14.5inch barrel. This gun gives you military standard lethality from a lighter and much more manoeuvrable weapon.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Pistol ammunition, fired from an assault rifle - cut down to a pistol. Redundant? Perhaps. A way to get around local firearm laws? Likely. Or something to squeeze some extra life out of all that pistol ammunition? Possible depending on your present situation.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Pistol ammunition, fired from an assault rifle - cut down to a pistol. Redundant? Perhaps. A way to get around local firearm laws? Likely. Or something to squeeze some extra life out of all that pistol ammunition? Possible depending on your present situation.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Micro-AR in .40 S&W, better hitting potential than a pistol, but none of the bulk of aa full size carbine. Optional trigger group if you need burst fire out of this little death bringer.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A Micro-AR in .40 S&W, better hitting potential than a pistol, but none of the bulk of aa full size carbine. Optional trigger group if you need burst fire out of this little death bringer.

ITEM.szItemDesc: AR-15, .45ACP, and hand cannons - three American firearm cliches combined into one weapon. At the very least the long barrel (for a pistol) and weight will increase controllability.
ITEM.szBRDesc: AR-15, .45ACP, and hand cannons - three American firearm cliches combined into one weapon. At the very least the long barrel (for a pistol) and weight will increase controllability.

ITEM.szItemDesc: You really do not need much of a barrel to get the most out of .45 ACP. This Micro-AR can take most AR accessories such as a choice of stocks, and burst trigger group.
ITEM.szBRDesc: You really do not need much of a barrel to get the most out of .45 ACP. This Micro-AR can take most AR accessories such as a choice of stocks, and burst trigger group.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Likely the most powerful pistol you will find here, short of stuffing 7.62x51mm into an old Automag.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Likely the most powerful pistol you will find here, short of stuffing 7.62x51mm into an old Automag.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Likely the most compact and handy 6.8mm SPC weapon you will find. Stock, this Micro-AR comes with a lightweight hand guard that may be replaced with a short quad rail system. Other options include precision stocks and burst trigger group.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Likely the most compact and handy 6.8mm SPC weapon you will find. Stock, this Micro-AR comes with a lightweight hand guard that may be replaced with a short quad rail system. Other options include precision stocks and burst trigger group.

ITEM.szBRDesc: Tired of having to pack an Assault Rifle and an additional Shotgun? With this specially adapted shotgun, you can carry 2 in 1!

ITEM.szBRDesc: Reliability and ease of use are key features of this Swiss made handgun. The .357 Sig round adds magnum like performance, but without any reduction in capacity.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The reduced snag version of the P226 pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Reliability and ease of use are key features of this Swiss made handgun. Improved with the SIG-Anti-Snag system.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SIG P226 first appeared in 1983, and is the official sidearm of the US Navy SEALs. This variant has been re-chambered for the .40 S&W round.

ITEM.szBRDesc: A stainless steel slide and the SIG-Anti-Snag system (for easier concealed carrying) are improvements over the standard version.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Someone was obviously so impressed by the toy that he made a real one. Go Figure...

ITEM.szItemDesc: A straight-pull bolt-action rifle with a futuristic look. Pull back pistol grip to chamber a new round, but take care of your trigger finger: the trigger guard moves as well, but the trigger does not!
ITEM.szBRDesc: The S&O Shorty is a straight-pull bolt-action bullpup design with a very unique action: to chamber a new round, you pull the pistol grip. It's made for hunting, despite the futuristic look. And if you're hunting the most dangerous animal of all, then it can also act as a mid range sniper rifle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed as a police weapon from the ground up, it was introduced in 1979.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Venerated by the same mobsters it ventilated, the 1928A1 is by no means a museum piece.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Employed by gangsters and G-Men alike, the Tommy gun's status as an antique shouldn't deter modern users from making use of its firepower.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The successor to the Tommy Gun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Although heavier than most submachine guns, the 'Tommy Gun' is still favoured by Commando and Ranger forces. None have been built since the 1960's, but they are still very common, and have definitely weathered the test of time.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Hollywood armourers assembled a few practical examples of this iconic sci-fi weapon in the 1980's. This modern functional movie prop replica is tough enough to be used on battlefield as you unlease your inner Space Marine.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Developed in the late 1920's, this pistol was the official side arm of the Red Army in WW2.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Developed in the late 1920's, this pistol was the official side arm of the Red Army in WW2. For its time, the TT was a formidable weapon, with good penetration and range.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The best thing to come out of South Africa since Apartheid ended.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The VIS-35 was the standard issue sidearm of the Polish military in WW2.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The VIS-35 was the standard issue sidearm of the Polish military in WW2. It is still manufactured today in limited quantities for collectors. According to some sources, it is one of the best handguns ever built.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Cheaper, lower quality cousin of the VSS Vintorez.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This silenced sniper rifle is made by KBP, a company known for manufacturing aircraft cannons and anti-tank missiles. Who could ask for anything more? Oh, and did we mention it can go full auto?

ITEM.szItemDesc: A very special sniper rifle that comes with integral silencer, integral bipod, and fires subsonic AP ammunition.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Quite new on the market, the Russian Vychlop (which means 'Exhaust') coughs up something more substantial (and more deadly) than carbon monoxide. Comes with integral bipod plus Battle Scope.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Lightweight and compact, the Walther G22 takes the principles of Walther’s famed .22 caliber pistols and adapts them to rifle form. For the first time, Walther has incorporated the Bullpup design to a .22 rifle, giving the G22 its compact size.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Lightweight and compact, the Walther G22 takes the principles of Walther’s famed .22 caliber pistols and adapts them to rifle form. For the first time, Walther has incorporated the Bullpup design to a .22 rifle, giving the G22 its compact size.

As a possible contender for Russian military orders, the Strizh pistol is extra tough to allow the use of hot +P+ 9x19mm service rounds such as the armour piercing 7N21 and 7N31.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Alluding to Arsenal Firearms goal to produce the next sidearm for the Russian military is the Spetsnaz machine pistol variant of the Strizh, or Strike One, pistol. The very low barrel will certainly help to reduce recoil effects from bursts of automatic fire.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Alluding to Arsenal Firearms goal to produce the next sidearm for the Russian military is the Spetsnaz machine pistol variant of the Strizh, or Strike One, pistol. The very low barrel will certainly help to reduce recoil effects from bursts of automatic fire.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Externally resembling many other modern polymer striker fired pistol the Strizh features a locking system that does not tilt or rotate the extremely low barrel. Another feature the Strizh shares with competing pistols is availability in calibres such as .40 S&W.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Externally resembling many other modern polymer striker fired pistol the Strizh features a locking system that does not tilt or rotate the extremely low barrel. Another feature the Strizh shares with competing pistols is availability in calibres such as .40 S&W.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The machine pistol has not gone out of fashion for Russian headquartered Arsenal Firearms, nor for its plants in Italy and Austria. The proof is in this .40 S&W machine pistol variant of the Strizh or Strike One for international buyers.

ITEM.szItemDesc: At under a thousand dollars, Taurus is agressively targeting the civilian market with its new pistol calibre carbine. Good value considering this lineage of this weapon includes the excelent FAMAE SAF and the Swiss Sig 540.
ITEM.szBRDesc: At under a thousand dollars, Taurus is agressively targeting the civilian market with its new pistol calibre carbine. Good value considering this lineage of this weapon includes the excelent FAMAE SAF and the Swiss Sig 540.

ITEM.szItemDesc: When Brazilian gun maker Taurus bought the SAF line one improvement was to introduce it in .40 S&W. Now the civilian shooter can get a taste of this with the CT-40 carbine.
ITEM.szBRDesc: When Brazilian gun maker Taurus bought the SAF line one improvement was to introduce it in .40 S&W. Now the civilian shooter can get a taste of this with the CT-40 carbine.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Second generation Taurus MT-9, with more plastic, tactical rails, and controllability. With light weapons, slower cyclic rate means more shots hit under automatic fire.

ITEM.szItemDesc: It was important for local Brazilian buyers to have the Metralhadora Taurus - Taurus Submachine gun - in .40 S&W. G2 weapons feature more tactical rails, improved ergonomics and controllable rate of fire.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Going beyond simply being a modular rifle, the DRD Paratus can be easily broken down for concealed transport to your sniper's nest. Fully assembled it is clearly a deadly weapon.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Going beyond simply being a modular rifle, the DRD Paratus can be easily broken down for concealed transport to your sniper's nest. Fully assembled it is clearly a deadly weapon.

ITEM.szItemDesc: When broken down the DRD Paratus can be easily hidden from opposing forces hunting your sniper. Just don't go waving the more obvious parts around in your hand.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Basically the Vepr 12 is a 12 gauge shotgun based on the RPK-74 aimed at sport shooters, including IPSC rule competitors, as well as hunters, home defence, and tactical markets. The bolt hold-open feature allows for quicker reloads over the similar Saiga shotgun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Basically the Vepr 12 is a 12 gauge shotgun based on the RPK-74 aimed at sport shooters, including IPSC rule competitors, as well as hunters, home defence, and tactical markets. The bolt hold-open feature allows for quicker reloads over the similar Saiga shotgun.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Basically the Vepr 12 is a 12 gauge shotgun based on the RPK-74 aimed at sport shooters, including IPSC rule competitors, as well as hunters, home defence, and tactical markets. The bolt hold-open feature allows for quicker reloads over the similar Saiga shotgun.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Originally designed as a low cost military SMG, but making itself infamous due to its association with gangsters and drug dealers during the crime height of the 90s in USA. Hollywood armourers have been known to convert these for automatic fire.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Originally designed as a low cost military SMG, but making itself infamous due to its association with gangsters and drug dealers during the crime height of the 90s in USA. Hollywood armourers have been known to convert these for automatic fire.

ITEM.szItemDesc: An armourer has converted this TEC DC9 into a full automatic (only) weapon. By any standards a crude weapon, but if it is all you have...
ITEM.szBRDesc: *** Not available from BR's. Please report this bug. ***

ITEM.szItemDesc: The perfect weapon if you want the look of a gangster or urban psychopath but do not have the cash for proper ammunition.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The perfect weapon if you want the look of a gangster or urban psychopath but do not have the cash for proper ammunition.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A semi-skilled armourer has recreated what was originally a major manufacturing and safety defect - an automatic fire only TEC-22.
ITEM.szBRDesc: *** Not available from BR's. Please report this bug. ***

ITEM.szItemDesc: The M712 Schnellfeuer is the full automatic version of the renowned C96 "Broomhandle." It is regarded by some as the earliest example of a Personal Defense Weapon.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The M712 Schnellfeuer is the full automatic version of the renowned C96 "Broomhandle." It is regarded by some as the earliest example of a Personal Defense Weapon.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The iconic C96 "Broomhandle" has seen action around the world in its long and storied history.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The iconic C96 "Broomhandle" has seen action around the world in its long and storied history.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This ergonomically shaped pistol from Slovakia is known for its Double-Tap function which fires two rounds in less than 0.1 second.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This ergonomically shaped pistol from Slovakia is known for its Double-Tap function which fires two rounds in less than 0.1 second.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Bren Ten is known as a first factory manufactured handgun to be chambered for the powerful 10mm auto cartridge, developed by Norma.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Bren Ten is known as a first factory manufactured handgun to be chambered for the powerful 10mm auto cartridge, developed by Norma.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The "Shipka" SMG was developed by Bulgarian company ARSENAL for police and military use, and currently is offered for export.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The "Shipka" SMG was developed by Bulgarian company ARSENAL for police and military use, and currently is offered for export.

ITEM.szItemDesc: P-93 is a modified version of the P-83 Wanad pistol. Externally and ballistically, the P-93 is very similar to SIG Sauer P-230.
ITEM.szBRDesc: P-93 is a modified version of the P-83 Wanad pistol. Externally and ballistically, the P-93 is very similar to SIG Sauer P-230.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Polish UZI comes with picatinny rail for a very wide variety of sights and other attachments.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Starting off as the Bushman Individual Defence Weapon, and later the Parker Hale Personal Defence Weapon, this mythical PDW features an electronically controlled hydraulic buffer system. ROF can be varied from 100-1400 rpm, with factory a factory set 450.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Dispite having the adjustable stock folded out of the way, the low recoil setting of Parker Hale PDW allows for comfortable single handed automatic fire.
ITEM.szBRDesc: *** Not available from BR's. Please report this bug. ***

ITEM.szItemDesc: With the regulator set to its lowest setting of 100 rpm and the adjustable stock deployed, the Parker Hale PDW is very easy to keep on target while on automatic fire.
ITEM.szBRDesc: *** Not available from BR's. Please report this bug. ***

ITEM.szItemDesc: Unregulated, the Parker Hale PDW will fire at 1400 rpm. Firing at this ROF one handed, without the benefit of the shoulder stock, is only useful for short duration suppressive fire.
ITEM.szBRDesc: *** Not available from BR's. Please report this bug. ***

ITEM.szItemDesc: Unregulated, the Parker Hale PDW will fire at 1400 rpm. Like all small SMG, the use of the shoulder stock is highly recogmended - and this one is adjustable for length.
ITEM.szBRDesc: *** Not available from BR's. Please report this bug. ***

ITEM.szItemDesc: This old Swiss SMG did not find commercial sucess in either its original 1941 or later 1944 revision, but its range is up to par with modern SMGs. Not to be confused with the W+F Lmg-Pist 41/44 designed by Col. Adolf Furrer.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This old Swiss SMG did not find commercial sucess in either its original 1941 or later 1944 revision, but its range is up to par with modern SMGs. Not to be confused with the W+F Lmg-Pist 41/44 designed by Col. Adolf Furrer.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The literal German translation is "Distress Signal Tool". It is marketed abroad as the Emergency Flare Launcher or EFL. With a five shot magazine, the EFL is a handy little flare launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This magazine holds 9 rounds of .357 Magnum standard ball ammunition. Its power leaves little question about its superiority as a combat handgun round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: We offer the finest quality rust resistant 9-round magazines, filled with Federal 158 grain .357 ammunition. These babies are a great way to finish off a problem that just won't kick it.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This magazine contains 9 rounds of .357 hollow point ammunition. The hollow point allows for substantial expansion on impact, thus creating a large but shallow wound.

ITEM.szItemDesc: While these 9 rounds of steel .357 armour piercing ammunition can penetrate walls and body armour, they only create small wound channels with minimal blood loss.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This magazine holds 9 rounds of .357 Magnum AET ammunition.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Even if the enemy's armour stops all else, it won't stop these!

ITEM.szBRDesc: Nine rounds of frangible fun. All of the man-stopping power, none of the over-penetration.

ITEM.szItemDesc: .40 S&W emerged in the late 1990s as "middle of the road" round with more stopping power than the 9mm and more penetration than the .45ACP.
ITEM.szBRDesc: .40S&W is a popular ammunition among many law enforcement officers.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This hollow point ammo gives increased punch to the .40 S&W's already significant stopping power.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The expansion power of HP adds substance to this powerful pistol ammunition.

ITEM.szItemDesc: 14 rounds of .40 S&W armour-piercing ammo.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Punch holes in the competition with these handy AP rounds.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A fruitful marriage of penetrating power and game-stopping expansion in .40 calibre.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Armoured targets will go down and stay down when you tag them with this potent AET round.

ITEM.szItemDesc: If 14 rounds of Glaser Safety ammo fail to make your point, the conversation wasn't worth having to begin with.

ITEM.szItemDesc: 6 rounds of .44 mag for rapid reload of your Dirty Harry revolver.

ITEM.szItemDesc: These .44 rounds have had their points drilled out to maximize their effectiveness against targets without armour.
ITEM.szBRDesc: For every aspiring Dirty Harry, or if you've just got a thing for making a big mess, these hollow point .44 rounds will really make your day.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Made primarily of brass, these rounds are designed to defeat most kinds of body armour and feature a Teflon coating to minimize barrel wear.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The infamous 'Cop Killer' round is now commercially available thanks to a convenient legislation loophole. Although not quite as effective as the NBC would have you believe, these can still pack a fair punch against targets wearing body armour.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. This is a supersonic loading with a soft lead bullet - perfect for causing all sorts of trauma.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. This is a supersonic loading with a soft lead bullet - perfect for causing all sorts of trauma.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. This is a supersonic loading with a light steel / aluminum mix bullet meant for extended range applications.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. This is a supersonic loading with a light steel / aluminum mix bullet meant for extended range applications.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. Two lightweight bullets have been stacked in a duplex configuration.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. Two lightweight bullets have been stacked in a duplex configuration.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 12.7x55mm is essentially a stubby version of the 12.7x54mm heavy subsonic round fired by KBP's own VSSK sniper rifle. The heavy bullet means this is a return to its roots – this is a subsonic round capable of defeating most body armour.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Another .30 cal bullet stuffed into the 5.56x45mm profile, the .300 Blackout does not sacrifice in capacity while increasing stopping power at all ranges.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Another .30 cal bullet stuffed into the 5.56x45mm profile, the .300 Blackout does not sacrifice in capacity while increasing stopping power at all ranges.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The larger 30 caliber bullet already increases damage potential of .300 BLACKOUT over traditional military rounds, but loaded with a hollow point hunting bullet the damage you can bring on target only goes up.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The larger 30 caliber bullet already increases damage potential of .300 BLACKOUT over traditional military rounds, but loaded with a hollow point hunting bullet the damage you can bring on target only goes up.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In pursuit of military sales for Advanced Armament Corp. and Remington's new .300 Blackout round an armour piercing load exits.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In pursuit of military sales for Advanced Armament Corp. and Remington's new .300 Blackout round an armour piercing load exits.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Glaser ammunition has double the impact of standard hollow point ammo. Unfortunately, it also has twice as much difficulty penetrating armour.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Glaser ammunition has double the impact of standard hollow point ammo. Unfortunately, it also has twice as much difficulty penetrating armour.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This round is heavy and very bright at night, what more do you need for automatic fire?
ITEM.szBRDesc: This round is heavy and very bright at night, what more do you need for automatic fire?

ITEM.szItemDesc: Though very new, the .300 Blackout has already found success in long distance shooting competitions. A match loading is of course key to this success.

ITEM.szBRDesc: Due to the lightweight nature of .22 Long Rifle transonic (crossing the speed of sound) effects on accuracy are more pronounced as the bullet slows. Match grade .22 LR often avoid this by simply being subsonic loadings.

ITEM.szItemDesc: These .22 Long Rifle rounds are subsonic to improve accuracy, and hollow point to increase lethality.
ITEM.szBRDesc: These .22 Long Rifle rounds are subsonic to improve accuracy, and hollow point to increase lethality.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Extra hot .22 Long Rifle ball loading. Better range and damage than standard loadings.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Extra hot .22 Long Rifle ball loading. Better range and damage than standard loadings.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Extra hot .22 Long Rifle hollow point loading. This round increases your reach against small game targets.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Extra hot .22 Long Rifle hollow point loading. This round increases your reach against small game targets.

ITEM.szItemDesc: If you must use .22 Long Rifle, you will want to land as many hits as possible - and a tracer bullet will certainly help under low light conditions.
ITEM.szBRDesc: If you must use .22 Long Rifle, you will want to land as many hits as possible - and a tracer bullet will certainly help under low light conditions.

ITEM.szItemDesc: .22 Long Rifle is the world's most popular ammunition for pistols and rifles alike. This is a standard power ball loading.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Hollow Point bullets would certainly increase the killing power of the diminutive .22 Long Rifle calibre.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The .30-06 cartridge was born in 1906 as an evolution of the short-lived, and round-nosed bullet .30-03. The M1906 cartridge, today universally known as .30-06, had slightly different case and, more important, it was loaded with pointed bullet.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The .30-06 cartridge was born in 1906 as an evolution of the short-lived, and round-nosed bullet .30-03. The M1906 cartridge, today universally known as .30-06, had slightly different case and, more important, it was loaded with pointed bullet.

ITEM.szItemDesc: "Thirty-aught-six," was the standard U.S. military round for much of the first half of the 20th century. Since its regular use by the the US military, the .30-06 remains popular with hunters, creating a market for hollow point loadings.
ITEM.szBRDesc: "Thirty-aught-six," was the standard U.S. military round for much of the first half of the 20th century. Since its regular use by the the US military, the .30-06 remains popular with hunters, creating a market for hollow point loadings.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Taking the pointed spitzer bullet one step further is the armour piercing .30-03 cartridge. The M2 round is used against lightly armored vehicles, protective shelters, and personnel.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Taking the pointed spitzer bullet one step further is the armour piercing .30-03 cartridge. The M2 round is used against lightly armored vehicles, protective shelters, and personnel.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The .30-06 actually predates the invention of tracer bullets. Since 1917 .30-06 has been widely available with a tracer bullet for observing fire, signaling, target designation, and incendiary purposes.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The .30-06 actually predates the invention of tracer bullets. Since 1917 .30-06 has been widely available with a tracer bullet for observing fire, signaling, target designation, and incendiary purposes.

ITEM.szItemDesc: .30-06 cartridges are still used in marksmanship competitions, and can be identified by the word "MATCH" on the head stamp.
ITEM.szBRDesc: .30-06 cartridges are still used in marksmanship competitions, and can be identified by the word "MATCH" on the head stamp.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Starting out as a black powder round, .303 British served for 70 years in various armed forces in the British Commonwealth. Surplus Mark VII rounds with a pointed speitzer ball loading is readily available for general purpose use.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Starting out as a black powder round, .303 British served for 70 years in various armed forces in the British Commonwealth. Surplus Mark VII rounds with a pointed speitzer ball loading is readily available for general purpose use.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Before the Hague Convention, .303 British was issued for military use with hollow point bullets. Today it makes an excellent hunting cartridge.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Before the Hague Convention, .303 British was issued for military use with hollow point bullets. Today it makes an excellent hunting cartridge.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The last armour-piercing loading of the venerable .303 British was the W Mark 1Z introduced in 1945. Like many specialized loadings it is avaialbe as surplus.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The last armour-piercing loading of the venerable .303 British was the W Mark 1Z introduced in 1945. Like many specialized loadings it is avaialbe as surplus.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Used to ignite zeppelins during the First World War, tracer rounds are still available as surplus. The last in regular UK service was the G Mark 8 introduced in 1945.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Used to ignite zeppelins during the First World War, tracer rounds are still available as surplus. The last in regular UK service was the G Mark 8 introduced in 1945.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Match grade ammunition in .303 British is all modern production ammunition, or hand loaded.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Match grade ammunition in .303 British is all modern production ammunition, or hand loaded.

ITEM.szItemDesc: X3 cartridges are 15ft range live cartridges. They contain a primer, gas capsule, probes, serialized tags and conductive wires.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Also called .380 Auto, 9mm Browning, 9mm Corto, 9mm Kurz, 9mm Short, and 9×17mm, the .380 ACP is low power round perfect for very simple and compact blowback pistols and machine pistols.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Also called .380 Auto, 9mm Browning, 9mm Corto, 9mm Kurz, 9mm Short, and 9×17mm, the .380 ACP is low power round perfect for very simple and compact blowback pistols and machine pistols.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Maximize defensive power out of your .380 ACP weapon with these hollow point rounds.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Maximize defensive power out of your .380 ACP weapon with these hollow point rounds.

ITEM.szItemDesc: While the .380 ACP is not a "military" round, there are military users of this chambering who will need an armour piercing loading.
ITEM.szBRDesc: While the .380 ACP is not a "military" round, there are military users of this chambering who will need an armour piercing loading.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Often situations where a concealed weapon, such as a .380ACP pistol, is desirable - are also those where over penetration is a problem, such as inside airliners. Glaser Safe Slug loadings are made for just those scenarios.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Often situations where a concealed weapon, such as a .380ACP pistol, is desirable - are also those where over penetration is a problem, such as inside airliners. Glaser Safe Slug loadings are made for just those scenarios.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In places where military rounds such as the 9x19mm and .45ACP are not available for civilian competition shooters there is the .380 ACP in match grade loadings.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Often situations where a concealed weapon, such as a .380ACP pistol, is desirable - are also those where over penetration is a problem, such as inside airliners. Glaser Safe Slug loadings are made for just those scenarios.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Often situations where a concealed weapon, such as a .380ACP pistol, is desirable - are also those where over penetration is a problem, such as inside airliners. Glaser Safe Slug loadings are made for just those scenarios.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In places where military rounds such as the 9x19mm and .45ACP are not available for civilian competition shooters there is the .380 ACP in match grade loadings.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In places where military rounds such as the 9x19mm and .45ACP are not available for civilian competition shooters there is the .380 ACP in match grade loadings.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This unmodified AR magazine was designed to hold 30 rounds of 5.56x45mm but with the larger .458 SOCOM can hold 10. These rounds contain more aerodynamic "Spitzer" bullets giving you more stand off distance against hogs.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This unmodified AR magazine was designed to hold 30 rounds of 5.56x45mm but with the larger .458 SOCOM can hold 10. These rounds contain more aerodynamic "Spitzer" bullets giving you more stand off distance against hogs.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This unmodified AR magazine was designed to hold 30 rounds of 5.56x45mm but with the larger .458 SOCOM can hold 10. These are hollow point rounds designed to both stop wild boars and operate well with suppressors.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This unmodified AR magazine was designed to hold 30 rounds of 5.56x45mm but with the larger .458 SOCOM can hold 10. These are hollow point rounds designed to both stop wild boars and operate well with suppressors.

ITEM.szItemDesc: With a pointy Spitzer type bullets these .458 SOCOM rounds will give you extra range. The availability of AP/FMJ is a legacy of this calibres military origins.
ITEM.szBRDesc: With a pointy Spitzer type bullets these .458 SOCOM rounds will give you extra range. The availability of AP/FMJ is a legacy of this calibres military origins.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Available from more suppliers than .50 Beowulf, the .458 SOCOM is gaining an increasing share of the large calibre AR market. Control the wild boar population, discreetly, with this HP round designed to work out of suppressed rifles.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Available from more suppliers than .50 Beowulf, the .458 SOCOM is gaining an increasing share of the large calibre AR market. Control the wild boar population, discreetly, with this HP round designed to work out of suppressed rifles.
